content.description: The crux of this route is pulling the bulge. It is a classic route.
content.location: This route is to the right of Three Easy Pieces (which is the left-most bolted line) and it shares the anchors with it.

content.description:
A seemingly impossible start (particularly if you're shorter) leads to a good rest. (One piece)

A delicate move is followed by a bit of pumpy climbing on some large holds, followed by another rest. (Two pieces)

The last section to the chains is pleasingly technical with the occasional I-really-hope-I-can-find-a-hold-soon moment. (Three pieces)
content.location: This is the farthest left route at the wall; starts up a blank-looking (ok, a blank) section just to the left of a tiny roof below a bulge.

content.description: A bouldery start leads to fun technical climbing at the top.
content.location: This route is just right of Princess Di.

content.description:
A strenuous, mildly nerve-wracking start (don't fall before the first bolt) through two bolts, then fun almost-corner climbing to a lip.

Tricky, seemingly-committing climbing (you're not going to get hurt) over the lip and then to the chains.
content.location:
The left-center of the

Bingo Baby

area is dominated by a large roof about fifteen to twenty feet off the ground. At the right side of this area is a corner trough. This line ascends the trough and goes left over the lip at the top of the corner trough.

Start on the first two bolts of the line

40 oz to Freedom

just left of where the gully with the fixed line starts, then head left into the trough.

content.description: This is a super classic route with fun movement.
content.location: This route is just right of The Beckoning Call

content.description:
An enjoyable jaunt up less-than-vertical limestone, using some big edges and jugs, a few small pockets, and chert-edged crimps here and there.

The start is mildly intimidating, even though there is a huge jug on which to start because the move to get to and clip the second bolt is a stretch and you're close to the ground. After standing up on the big, starting jug, continue up through some fun movement using sidepulls and balance. Near the middle of the route you'll wonder where the bigger holds went; fortunately, chert comes to the rescue.

The top is a bit of fun; going far left and then cutting back to the chains is probably easier than going straight up, but not as rewarding.
content.location:
The left route on the face which is in front of the fixed-rope gully which is at the right side of

Bingo Baby

wall. Starts from a ledge on top of some lower-angled rock.

content.description:
A really good mid-11 route with a little bit of everything

American Fork

has to offer. Starts out essentially vertical, then the angle eases a bit, and ends up slightly overhanging.

Start with some fun liebacking movement through the first couple of bolts, move a bit higher, notice the feet disappear , so stem to the leaning slab to the right. Get back solely onto the face when able and continue up using pockets of varying usefulness (and sharpness).

Near the top the pockets get smaller and, perversely, someone turned most of them the wrong way. Feet are harder to find (but they're there), and a bit of body positioning flexibility will see it though to the chains.
content.location:
The right line on the face which is in front of the fixed-rope gully which is at the right side of

Bingo Baby

. Next to a leaning, detached slab of limestone that lies against the face containing the bolts.

content.description: Medulla Oblongata is very similar in nature to 48, some enjoyable, but hard climbing to a good rest, after the rest enjoy some jugs up to a crux run to the chains. I think they are both equally enjoyable and should both see more traffic.
content.protection: Occasionally has draws hanging from it
content.location: This route is on top of the boulder ledge and is just to the left of 48.

content.description: The crux on this route is pulling over the roof. It has a jugs at the top and a technical start.
content.location: This route is just right of The Tuba.

content.description: This is a technical route that start on the far right side of the gully.
content.protection: Bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This route is the farthest right route in the gully.

climbs.name: If I Only Had a Brain

content.description: Shares the first five bolts with Bringer of Light and then splits right. Redpoint crux at the very top.
content.location: Shares the start of Bringer of Light and then branches right.

content.description: This route starts on the ledge next to An Affair to Remember. It heads straight up to finish on chains. It is a good idea to start with the first bolt stick clipped.
content.location: This route start on the ledge just right of An Affair to Remember.

content.description: This route begins on Bringer of Light and heads left after the first bolt to join Chockdust Torture at the 5th bolt and finishes on Chockdust Torture.
content.location: Starts on Bringer of light and finishes on Chockdust Torture.

content.description: A technical start with good, but tricky holds to the first bolt, then a pumpy bit to get established into the open book above. Once established, cruiser climbing to the chains.
content.protection: 4 bolts to chain anchor. Stick clip the first bolt.
content.location:
The left-center section of the

Bingo Baby

is dominated by a large roof fifteen to twenty feet off the ground.

At the left side of the roof is a trough/seam (essentially an open book) with bolts on the left wall. This line climbs the technical bit up to the trough and then continues up the trough to chains on the left side.

content.description:
A technical start with crimpy sidepulls and devious feet leads to occasional pockets and chert edges.

Start up the tricky first bit to the second bolt, then gain a brief respite on better feet. Surmount the first of two bulges into pockets, and then the second bulge with reachy moves between good holds. Finally, enjoy chert edges to the chains.
content.location:
The center line on the face which is in front of the fixed-rope gully which is at the right side of

Bingo Baby

.

content.description:
Mildly technical climbing to a roof, followed by strenuous moves from poor feet to surmount the roof.

After the roof comes pumpy, slightly overhanging climbing until you traverse left onto the face after the fifth bolt. (If you go right at the fifth bolt you're on

If I Only Had a Brain

.)

Easier climbing to the top with good pockets (and a surprise at the end).
content.location:
Found at the right side of the middle section of the wall dominated by the huge roof.

This line turns the roof at the right side (there are two side-by-side bolts under the roof), just before a trough/corner. The line to the right (start of

Protozoa

/

40 oz to Freedom

) seems to always have draws on it.

content.description: This is a crimpy powerful route that pulls over the roof.
content.location: This route is two routes to the right of Slopbuckets.

content.description: This route has a powerful technical start and then once the roof is pulled it leads to jugs to the top.
content.location: This route is just right of Bingo Baby

content.description: Balancy moves on edges and sidepulls lead up to a strenuous roof with big, oddly-cambered holds and poor feet. Fight the pump through the steepness to large holds up top, and then a reachy clip at the chains.
content.location:
Near the left side of the middle section of the wall that is dominated by the huge roof.

Find a trough/corner with bolted line up it. That line is

Foreplay

. The bolted line immediately right is

The Beckoning Call

. At the time of this writing there is a long permadraw on the 3rd bolt.

content.description: This route starts on the ledge at the right side of the wall. It is the farthest route to the left and crosses 40 oz to Freedom and pulls the roof to the left.
content.location: This route crosses 40 oz to Freedom and pulls the roof to the left.

content.description: This route is a super classic that is the middle route in the gully. It has some technical sections and you pull the roof in the middle.
content.location: This route is to the right of Medulla Oblongata and is the middle route in the gully.

content.description: This route shares the first couple of bolts with Protozoa then continues straight up under the roof and pulls the roof to the right and finishes several bolts above the roof. This is a super classic endurance route!
content.protection: Bolts to a chain anchor, the draws are usually fixed on the route.
content.location: This route starts to the right of a huge rock at the base of Bringer of Light. It shares the first couple bolts with Protozoa.
